column4: im learning python and seems that gnome terminal works as python, so i was wondering if gnome terminal had something of python code on it
the shell can interpret scripts and so forth, you can run python code as you need
thats why bash scripts have #!/bin/bash  at the top, python will have a python based line.
you can use python in gnome-terminal
the same way you use bash scripts
just start a text file with:  #!/usr/bin/python       and use python commands, it will run. You will need to make the text file executable
when you run it, the interpretter will see you telling it to use python, and itwill be used
whack it in a text file, mark it as executable and you have a python script
frets on fire is python based
it's not going to stop in 2012
no, Quantal is supported for 18 months after release, it will continue for a long long time to come
